page.title: 13ELEPHANT ROCK
page.content: ELEPHANT ROCK IS ONE OF MY FAVOURITE PLACES. THE REASON WHY IT IS MY FAVOURITE PLACE IS THAT IT IS EASY TO CLIMB. IT IS CALLED ELEPHANT ROCK BECAUSE IT IS SHAPED LIKE AN ELEPHANT. THERE IS A CLIMB KNOWN BY THE CLIMBERS OF MILLOM CALLED THE TRUNK. IT IS QUITE A HARD CLIMB BECAUSE MY DAD COULD NOT MAKE IT LAST TIME WE WENT UP THERE. THERE ARE LOTS OF OTHER WAYS UP THAT ARE QUITE EASY AND THAT CHILDREN OF ABOUT SIX LIKE MY SISTER, CAN MANAGE. THE WALK UP FROM THE ROAD TAKES ABOUT TEN MINUTES. IT IS NICE EXCEPT FOR THE GORSE WHICH IS SO PRICKLY WHEN YOU TRY TO GET THROUGH IT. THE VIEW FROM THE TOP IS VERY GOOD ON A CLEAR DAY. YOU CAN SEE THE SLAG BANK AND SHIPYARDS AT BARROW WHICH ARE ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DUDDON ESTUARY.
